description: A long lived cemetery site spanning the Iron Age to the Early Medieval period. The cemetery contained a shaft which gave access to an underground chamber interpreted as a shrine, the cave was filled in by the 2nd C CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Mill Hill, England, Kent, Deal.” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Parfitt. “Iron Age Burials from Mill Hill, Deal,” 1995.
